title: 104_hr3645
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Environmental Education Amendments Act of 1996". The Office of Environmental Education is established. Section 4 of the National Environmental Education Act (20 U.S.C. 5503) is amended to include balanced and scientifically sound support, renumber paragraphs, and specify outreach through agency headquarters and regional offices. Section 4 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to include support through agency headquarters and regional offices, with specified staff requirements and activities for the Office of Environmental Education. The Office of Environmental Education must have a headquarters staff of up to 10 employees and one full-time employee in each regional office to support its activities through grants, agreements, or contracts. SEC. 3 amends the National Environmental Education Act by reducing the percentage of funding for environmental education grants and prohibiting the use of grants for lobbying activities. SEC. 4 focuses on environmental internships and fellowships. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by removing and redesignating certain sections. Conforming amendments are made to the table of contents and section 4(b). The National Environmental Education Act is amended by removing and redesignating certain sections, including sections 7 through 10. Amendments are made to section 4(b) by updating references to the newly designated sections. Amendments are made to various sections of the National Environmental Education Act, including updating references to newly designated sections. Amendments to the National Environmental Education Act include the establishment of the President's Environmental Youth Awards for students in grades K-12 who excel in promoting local environmental awareness. Additionally, the creation of an Environmental Education Advisory Council and Task Force is proposed. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to establish an Advisory Council with up to 11 members appointed by the Administrator, representing various sectors in environmental education. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to establish an Advisory Council with representatives from different sectors in environmental education, including primary and secondary education, colleges and universities, not-for-profit organizations, State departments, business and industry, and senior Americans. Membership on the Task Force is open to representatives of any Federal agency engaged in environmental education. The Advisory Council under the National Environmental Education Act will hold biennial meetings on environmental education issues and provide recommendations. Membership on the Task Force is open to representatives from any Federal agency involved in environmental education. SEC. 7. NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOUNDATION. The name of the National Environmental Education Act is changed to the Foundation for Environmental Education. Amendments are made to reflect this name change in the Act. Amendments are made to update references in the Act to reflect this name change. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to change the name of the foundation and increase the number of directors. Additionally, a condition of donations is removed from the Act. Authorization of appropriations is granted in Section 8. Section 10 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to authorize appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 1997 to 2007. The amendment includes specific funding amounts for each year and limitations on the use of funds. The National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. Limitations on fund usage include allocating 25% for the Office of Environmental Education, 25% for the environmental education and training program, 40% for environmental education grants, and 10% for the Foundation for Environmental Education. The National Environmental Education Act allocates funds for various environmental education programs. 40% is designated for environmental education grants, and 10% for the Foundation for Environmental Education. Administrative expenses are limited to 25% for the Office of Environmental Education. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as of either October 1, 1996, or the date of enactment of this Act.
